Teaching

Aliquam ut ex ut interdum donec amet imperdiet eleifend

Teaching methodology

Every individual is unique. That’s why I believe teaching methods should be catered to the individual. This way, the individual can discover his/her own sound and bring their own unique personality into the music.

Ever wondered how that drummer played that super fast complex lick or groove and made it look effortless? Well, we all have, and to them, it IS effortless. This kind of natural & effortless playing is achieved from practicing with good technique and in turn, avoiding any long term pain or discomfort, sustaining playing heavy, at faster tempos and all the while looking cool and doing it effortlessly. For these reasons, there are integral techniques that will always be covered in order to lay a solid foundation.

Having painstakingly studied music formally, I can also teach music theory, aural skills and music notation. My experience includes teaching privately as well as in schools so all ages and ability levels are welcome.

Learning should always be an exciting process. I always relate everything back to the end product - which is the music! This way, there is always context to help solidify understanding and provide examples as well as space for individual experimentation and creativity. I always teach a variety of styles in order for students to become well-rounded, versatile players, but I highly encourage all students to bring music or styles (praying they don’t bring every soundtrack from Whiplash again) they’re particularly interested in to work on. This keeps students motivated, engaged & helps build their own unique feel / style.
